com.defano.jmonet.canvas

Class Scratch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.canvas.Scratch

  • public class Scratch
extends Object
    A scratch buffer on which to draw ephemeral changes to the canvas.

    The scratch buffer provides a graphic context on which paint tools can draw without modifying the canvas. For example, the selection tool needs a layer on which to draw marching ants that does not result in the ants becoming part of the underlying graphic. In general, all tools should draw on the scratch buffer until the change is ready to be committed to the canvas; for many tools (like the paintbrush, pencil, line, or rectangle), the change is complete only when the user releases the mouse.

    The scratch buffer provides two scratch "modes": an "add" scratch for changes that add paint to the canvas, and a "remove" scratch for changes that erase paint from the canvas. The add scratch works by overlaying the scratch graphic to the canvas using composite mode AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER; the remove scratch uses AlphaComposite.DST_OUT.

    The dimension of the scratch buffer always matches the dimension of the canvas, but for performance, the scratch buffer manages a dirty region to paint only the portion of the buffer that the tool has modified.

      Scratch(int width, int height)
      Creates a scratch unbound to any tool with a given dimension.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears the scratch buffer (both add and remove buffers), restoring it to its original, unmodified (fully transparent) state.
      void clearAddScratch()
      Clears the add-scratch buffer, restoring it to its original, unmodified (fully transparent) state.
      void clearRemoveScratch()
      Clears the remove-scratch buffer, restoring it to its original, unmodified (fully transparent) state.
      void erase(Tool tool, Shape shape, Stroke stroke)
      A convenience method to erase paint from all pixels bounded by a given shape and stroke, taking into account canvas background and erase color.
      GraphicsContext getAddScratchGraphics(Tool tool, Shape bounds)
      Gets the add-scratch graphics context configured and ready to be painted upon by the given tool.
      GraphicsContext getAddScratchGraphics(Tool tool, Stroke stroke, Shape shape)
      Gets the add-scratch graphics context configured and ready to be painted upon by the given tool.
      ImageLayer getAddScratchLayer()
      Gets an ImageLayer representing the add-scratch image.
      Rectangle getBounds()
      Gets the bounds (location and dimension) of the scratch buffer.
      Rectangle getDirtyRegion()
      Gets a rectangle identifying a sub-region of the scratch buffer that has been modified and needs to be repainted.
      ImageLayerSet getLayerSet()
      Gets an ImageLayerSet comprised of the add-scratch overlaid upon the remove-scratch.
      GraphicsContext getRemoveScratchGraphics(Tool tool, Shape bounds)
      Gets the remove-scratch graphics context configured and ready to be painted upon by the given tool.

      Gets the remove-scratch graphics context configured and ready to be painted upon by the given tool.

      Gets an ImageLayer representing the remove-scratch image.

      Gets the dimensions of the scratch buffer.

      Replaces the current remove-scratch buffer with a provided image.
      void setSize(int width, int height)
      Sets the size of the scratch buffer, keeping as much of the existing buffer's image as possible.

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int width,
                    int height)
        Sets the size of the scratch buffer, keeping as much of the existing buffer's image as possible.
        Parameters:
        width - The new width of the buffer
        height - The new height of the buffer

      • getSize

        public Dimension getSize()
        Gets the dimensions of the scratch buffer.
        Returns:
        The size of the scratch buffer

      • getBounds

        public Rectangle getBounds()
        Gets the bounds (location and dimension) of the scratch buffer. Note the buffer is always located at the orgin (0,0).
        Returns:
        The bounding rectangle of the scratch buffer.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the scratch buffer (both add and remove buffers), restoring it to its original, unmodified (fully transparent) state.

        public void clearAddScratch()
        Clears the add-scratch buffer, restoring it to its original, unmodified (fully transparent) state.

      • getRemoveScratchGraphics

        public GraphicsContext getRemoveScratchGraphics(Tool tool,
                                                Stroke stroke,
                                                Shape shape)
        Gets the remove-scratch graphics context configured and ready to be painted upon by the given tool. Anything drawn onto this graphics context will be "erased" from the underlying canvas by overlaying it with the AlphaComposite.DST_OUT composite mode.

        Accepts a stroke and shape to configure the clipping rectangle; the clipping region will be set equal to the union of the existing clipping region and the bounds of this stroked shape.

        Parameters:
        tool - The tool that will be drawing on the scratch, or null, if another type of object is requesting the buffer. Tool argument is used to retrieve the desired anti-aliasing mode for the context.
        stroke - The stroke that will be used when rendering the shape, or null if no stroke should be applied.
        shape - The shape that will be painted by the tool, or null if the existing clipping region shouldn't be modified.
        Returns:
        The remove-scratch buffer ready for use.

      • getRemoveScratchGraphics

        public GraphicsContext getRemoveScratchGraphics(Tool tool,
                                                Shape bounds)
        Gets the remove-scratch graphics context configured and ready to be painted upon by the given tool. Anything drawn onto this graphics context will be "erased" from the underlying canvas by overlaying it with the AlphaComposite.DST_OUT composite mode.

        Accepts a shape to configure the clipping rectangle; the clipping region will be set equal to the union of the existing clipping region and the bounds of the shape.

        Parameters:
        tool - The tool that will be drawing on the scratch, or null, if another type of object is requesting the buffer. Tool argument is used to retrieve the desired anti-aliasing mode for the context.
        bounds - The shape that will be painted by the tool, or null if the existing clipping region shouldn't be modified.
        Returns:
        The remove-scratch buffer ready for use.

      • getAddScratchGraphics

        public GraphicsContext getAddScratchGraphics(Tool tool,
                                             Stroke stroke,
                                             Shape shape)
        Gets the add-scratch graphics context configured and ready to be painted upon by the given tool. Anything drawn onto this graphics context will be "added" to the underlying canvas by overlaying it with the AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER composite mode.

        Accepts a stroke and shape to configure the clipping rectangle; the clipping region will be set equal to the union of the existing clipping region and the bounds of this stroked shape.

        Parameters:
        tool - The tool that will be drawing on the scratch, or null, if another type of object is requesting the buffer. Tool argument is used to retrieve the desired anti-aliasing mode for the context.
        stroke - The stroke that will be used when rendering the shape, or null if no stroke should be applied.
        shape - The shape that will be painted by the tool, or null if the existing clipping region shouldn't be modified.
        Returns:
        The remove-scratch buffer ready for use.

      • getAddScratchGraphics

        public GraphicsContext getAddScratchGraphics(Tool tool,
                                             Shape bounds)
        Gets the add-scratch graphics context configured and ready to be painted upon by the given tool. Anything drawn onto this graphics context will be "added" to the underlying canvas by overlaying it with the AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER composite mode.

        Accepts a shape to configure the clipping rectangle; the clipping region will be set equal to the union of the existing clipping region and the bounds of this shape.

        Parameters:
        tool - The tool that will be drawing on the scratch, or null, if another type of object is requesting the buffer. Tool argument is used to retrieve the desired anti-aliasing mode for the context.
        bounds - The shape that will be painted by the tool, or null if the existing clipping region shouldn't be modified.
        Returns:
        The remove-scratch buffer ready for use.

      • setAddScratch

        public void setAddScratch(BufferedImage addScratch,
                          Rectangle dirtyRgn)
        Replaces the current add-scratch buffer with a provided image. Set the buffer's clipping region to the bounds provided.
        Parameters:
        addScratch - The new add-scratch image.
        dirtyRgn - The dirty region of the new buffer; null means no area is dirty, whereas a rectangle whose dimensions equal those of the image means the entire buffer is dirty.

      • setRemoveScratch

        public void setRemoveScratch(BufferedImage removeScratch,
                             Rectangle dirtyRgn)
        Replaces the current remove-scratch buffer with a provided image. Sets the buffer's clipping region to the bounds of the image.
        Parameters:
        removeScratch - The new remove-scratch image.
        dirtyRgn - The dirty region of the new buffer; null means no area is dirty, whereas a rectangle whose dimensions equal those of the image means the entire buffer is dirty.

        Returns:

      • getLayerSet

        public ImageLayerSet getLayerSet()
        Gets an ImageLayerSet comprised of the add-scratch overlaid upon the remove-scratch.
        Returns:
        The scratch buffer as a ImageLayerSet.

      • erase

        public void erase(Tool tool,
                  Shape shape,
                  Stroke stroke)
        A convenience method to erase paint from all pixels bounded by a given shape and stroke, taking into account canvas background and erase color.
        Parameters:
        tool - The tool that is erasing
        shape - The shape to be erased
        stroke - The stroke of the shape being erased

      • getDirtyRegion

        public Rectangle getDirtyRegion()
        Gets a rectangle identifying a sub-region of the scratch buffer that has been modified and needs to be repainted.
        Returns:
        The region of the scratch buffer that has been marked as dirty by tools.
